thread.title: Protests Break Out Across Washington D.C. Over Donald Trump’s Inauguration
thread.title_full: Protests Break Out Across Washington D.C. Over Donald Trump’s Inauguration

author: Ken Meyer
title: Protests Break Out Across Washington D.C. Over Donald Trump’s Inauguration
text:
— Rachel Kurzius (@Curious_Kurz) January 20, 2017 
Various other protests have taken place around the city "In the name of humanity, we refuse a fascist America" Protesters circling McPherson Sq pic.twitter.com/qA8tQHgSMg 
— Alexandra Jaffe (@ajjaffe) January 20, 2017 
Some of the protests have descended into violent riots that have resulted in property damage; Protesters take to the streets of Washington ahead of Donald Trump's #inauguration https://t.co/3dAngYF0eY pic.twitter.com/cWx5pKBs4U 
— BBC Breaking News (@BBCBreaking) January 20, 2017 Protests turn violent in central Washington with shop & bank windows smashed on Donald Trump's #InaugurationDay https://t.co/3dAngYF0eY pic.twitter.com/DdNvdy4Ijm 
— BBC Breaking News (@BBCBreaking) January 20, 2017 Seems some anti-Trump anarchists did a number on this Starbucks near franklin square. #Inauguration pic.twitter.com/NzYC4vFkMG 
— Asawin Suebsaeng (@swin24) January 20, 2017 BREAKING NEWS: Washington, DC police responding to reports of anti Trump protesters smashing shop windows. pic.twitter.com/nLPB2oAV3m 
— Breaking News Feed (@pzf) January 20, 2017 . @ZoeTillman reports from #InaugurationDay protests: Protesters using flare guns, clash with police https://t.co/nXTaPYEPP6 pic.twitter.com/0MYbDQyU61 
— BuzzFeed News (@BuzzFeedNews) January 20, 2017 
Riot police have been dispatched around the city in order to address the chaos. BREAKING NEWS: TEAR GAS BEING DEPLOYED AT ANTI-TRUMP PROTESTERS IN DC. pic.twitter.com/8XZ6s7y1ye 
— Breaking News Feed (@pzf) January 20, 2017 Police forcefully cleared protestors out of a path to enter security at 7th and E #Inauguration pic.twitter.com/Q0j6cubZ8b 
— Steve Burns (@StvBurns) January 20, 2017 
UPDATE – 11:40 a.m. EST: Washington Post reporter Dalton Bennett was caught up in a protest, and was thrown to the ground by police responded to the situation. 
[Image via screengrab]
